title: Fix Share Preview sharing fallback and emphasize reaction time on share card

requirements.summary: Remove broken share-card download fallback and show screenshot/share instruction when native sharing is unavailable or fails
acceptanceCriteria: On the Share Preview screen, there is a clearly visible instruction in English telling users to take a screenshot and share it on social media (e.g., "If Share doesnâ€™t work, take a screenshot and share it on social media.").
Tapping the Share button no longer triggers an automatic file download as a fallback (no "Image downloaded!" toast).
If Web Share (with files) is unsupported or fails, the UI provides the screenshot instruction rather than attempting to download.

file_operations.description: Remove the download-based fallback from share behavior so sharing either uses Web Share (with files) or returns a non-success result; ensure failures are reported in a way the UI can use to show screenshot instructions rather than downloading.

Update Share Preview UI/logic to: (1) stop showing any download-related success toast, (2) display a clearly visible English instruction telling users to take a screenshot and share on social media when native sharing is not available or fails, and (3) keep the existing Share button using the shadcn-ui Button component for consistent styling (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

requirements.summary: Emphasize the reaction-time value on the Share Preview card with larger size and higher-contrast color while keeping the exact sentence text
acceptanceCriteria: On the Share Preview card, the reaction time number is visually emphasized (larger font size than the surrounding text).
The reaction time number uses a more prominent color (e.g., accent/primary) than the surrounding sentence text, improving readability on the existing winter-glass background.
The user-facing sentence remains exactly: "your reaction time to Boo is <XY>ms. Excellent!" (with <XY> replaced by the measured reaction time in milliseconds).

file_operations.description: Adjust the Share Preview card's reaction-time sentence rendering so the numeric value is wrapped/styled as a larger, higher-contrast inline element (e.g., accent/primary), while the surrounding text is less prominent; preserve the sentence exactly as: "your reaction time to Boo is <XY>ms. Excellent!".

Add or refine a shared style token/class string (if needed) to support higher-contrast emphasized numeric text on the winter-glass card without changing overall game flow; keep usage consistent with existing Tailwind/pixel style conventions.
